alert.note: Alert for Benson; Ramsey (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 12:26AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Benson and Ramsey Counties through 115 AM CDT... At 1224 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking gusty winds in excess of 40 mph ahead of thunderstorms along a line extending from near Maza to near Minnewaukan to 6 miles northeast of Bremen. Movement was east at 45 mph. Gusty winds may occur without any heavy rainfall and lightning. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Penn around 1230 AM CDT. Devils Lake, Lakewood Park and Camp Grafton around 1240 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Garske, Crary, Tokio, Warwick, Southam and Doyon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Devils Lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
